Text.Value: A quick rest, and then - to work. There's a lot of good a mind flayer could do in this world, and I intend to do it.

EditorData.logicalname: PLAYER ILLITHID + Gale proposed a drink

Text.Value: Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. I won't imbibe, but I'll be happy to be away from here, and in your company.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: There are many heroes' graves that will need to be dug. Many eulogies to be written.
*You feel a gentle tingling on your skin - a faint prickle that starts to spread across any exposed flesh.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Player Astarion starts to burn in the sun

Text.Value: If Baldur's Gate is too foolish to recognise its saviours, so be it. The city will miss your influence, as will I.
Lest we forget - there are still graves to dig, injured to thank, warriors to exalt.
*Your days in the sun are behind you. The best you can hope for is that you find darkness, and the comfort it once gave you.*
Let's get out of this city. The Underdark calls to me...
And so long as it doesn't please you to munch on my cerebellum, I'll be right behind you.
It seems you've found peace with yourself - I'm glad. Just as long as your intentions remain as pure as they are now.
True, we have served our respective purposes. We're free to go wherever we wish.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: *At least you would not be alone... if only you knew where Karlach was.*
As long as it's still you in there, and you haven't completely lost your mind.
I can't pretend to understand your ambitions, or what drives them, but I wish you well.
I won't lie. I'll miss our group. Hells, I'll even miss sleeping rough in the wilderness, to an extent.
They carved our course. Honour them with each and every step you take.
I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Be safe.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH rejected Shar)

Text.Value: I suppose our band wasn't meant to last forever... fate thrust us together, now it pulls us apart again.
We can spare more than a moment for Gale. And more than one drink.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: I wouldn't mind a very well-earned libation, myself.
It's far from the fate you deserve for the scale of your sacrifice, but I understand why you feel the need to do it.
The Underdark? As much as I appreciate its shadows, I think Lady Shar will have use for me elsewhere...

EditorData.NodeContext: Unconvinced. (Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar)

Text.Value: Astarion - the sun's already begun to take its toll on you. Truly, I am sorry.
But first, you and I are going to find the most hedonistic establishment in this city, and we are going to have a night that will go down in legend.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: To hide your face from the city you saved. You see now why this hero's business is not all story and song.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grimly sad for us - but she thinks we'll understand her general begrudgery about being called a 'hero' now.

Text.Value: You'd best seek shelter, Astarion, and quickly. The world owes you - but the sun feels no such debt.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion beginning to burn in the sun now he gave up his immunity. Gentle, but urgent - he gave up a lot, and it's not fair.

Text.Value: I'll stay in the city. The world could use a mind flayer with good intentions. And a mind flayer's intellect.
Were it any other mind flayer, I would put an end to this right now. But - I suppose you have earned the benefit of the doubt.
Very well. Perhaps after a drink or five I'll be tempted to inflict some of my singing on you all - as if the city has not suffered enough.
Then we'll both be carving our own paths. I wish you well in yours.
It looks like basking in the sun is no longer an option for you, Astarion. You'd better find some shade.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

Text.Value: Your intellect will be valuable indeed. So long as it remains uncorrupted.
A wise choice, ra'stil, perhaps the wisest you've ever made.

EditorData.NodeContext: rah-STILL. ally/friend

Text.Value: I can't believe I'm about to say this, but - part of me will miss you.
*You could stay, and help. Your considerable strengths would not be unwelcome in such an endeavour...*
*Though perhaps no harder than it ever was.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Loads of banches converge to this point

Text.Value: As you should, you have earned the right.
I suppose that's the last time any of us will see him, and the last time he'll ever see the sun.
The Underdark? All part of nature's creation, of course, but perhaps not its most hospitable corner, after all we've been through...
The Underdark? You poor thing. I have a palace, you can sleep on one of a hundred couches until you're on your feet.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: Walk safely into the dark. You were truly tentacular.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: How wonderful, but do try not to limit yourself. You've just saved the world, now is not the time to become boring.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: I had hoped we would not part so quickly. I have no home, and few friends remaining in this world.
A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand.

EditorData.NodeContext: Arc: SH abandoned Shar

Text.Value: Astarion...? Boo says you are beginning to smell like a festival-day feast...

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of gentle, friendly warning - Astarion is starting to smoke in the sun

Text.Value: You're joking. After everything we've been through, you expect me to do manual labour?

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: Amn? A keen idea - I was taught its Cloud Peaks are infested with monsters of all sorts. But first, fresh meat and a hot fire.
For a time, at least. Time has taught me not to traffic in farewells - they are rarely so final as you might think.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shrugging at player suggesting party go their separate ways, knowing smile. (Yes, very on the nose about a returning canon character)

Text.Value: I could scarcely have imagined a mind flayer as an ally or a friend once... but I shall miss you.
There are fallen to honour, as well. So many that we may never learn all of their names - but that is no reason not to try.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet grief and resolve

Text.Value: I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Lady Shar be with you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH is loyal to Shar)

Text.Value: I honestly don't mind what we do, once we get - ow!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Flinches, as if a bug bit him on the hand. The sun is starting to burn him, although Astarion doesn't realise yet
EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Full line: "once we get off this beach"

Text.Value: We will drink for Gale. Boo and I are banned from most of the inns in the city, but you may order for us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: We've certainly benefited from your gifts. It stands to reason that others may do so also.
Just remember who your friends are, will you? In case you start to become... well, you know, hungry.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: A lot of people died so we could get to this moment.
You are braver than I could ever dream to be. I hope we will meet again, on a cloudy night.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: Heroically spoken! We must find an inn. Minsc has been banned from his share of ale-halls, but I am sure you and Boo can speak for me.
I wouldn't mind paying Amn a visit. Never been that far south, myself.
Hells - Astarion. The sun's already begun to scorch you.
I can't guarantee you a warm welcome in the city, but should you find me, you'll have a seat at my table.
But first, we revel and rest.
Is this our final parting then? Please, reconsider. Alone, you are a storm. But together, we are a tempest.
As long as you have no designs on my mind, I do not much care what your intentions are.

EditorData.NodeContext: emphasis on 'what' - dismissing a former ally who has become a mind flayer and claims to have 'good' intentions

Text.Value: Easier said than done, I fear. You may find yourself welcome in some circles... but set upon in far more.
What the - oh gods. Oh no.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his hand, which is starting to smoke. Realises his time in the sun is up.
EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Realising your time in the sun is up. Sad, sullen

Text.Value: The Underdark? Not exactly on the top of my list, but I think I understand why the idea appeals to you.
It's true. Whatever benefits one illithid could bring will only be doubled when there are two.
I hope you are wrong, my friend.
Argh! I'm sorry, I - I have to go!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: now that the tadpole's gone, Astarion has started to burn in the sun
EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Without the tadpole's protection the sun is really starting to burn, you have to run for shade before it becomes too much

Text.Value: I may not belong to this land, but now, it belongs to me.
I think a celebration is in order.
Why leave? Baldur's Gate will be desperate for new leadership, and who better than us to lend our assistance.
Answer it, then - but you'll be going without me. I'm sorry.
It's not for everyone, but it is a wise choice for you.
Excellent. Let's see if the Elfsong's still standing. Their Golden Sands Brew goes down real easy.
Far from the fate you deserve for the sacrifices you have made, but... I understand.
Quite right.
A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand. May Lady Shar bless you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar

Text.Value: We should stay in the city. Help to rebuild it.
Not just the city - imagine the swathe of destruction the Absolute's armies will have caused.
Yes. Baldur's Gate will rise ever stronger. Let us be the ones to lay the first bricks.
You're burning up, soldier. Take cover!
My destiny lies in this city, with Lady Shar's church. They look to me now.
Perhaps we can circle back to that one, once the fires have died and the rubble's settled. I do think we deserve a little rest.
Then you must answer. But far more deadly terrain awaits me here. Home.

EditorData.NodeContext: not liking the idea to go the underdark

Text.Value: The sun is no longer your friend, then. A freedom you shall sorely miss, I feel.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some empathy

Text.Value: I fear you must. These people are too short-sighted to recognise a saviour in an unfamiliar form.
A wise decision. You will not be welcome here, no matter what miracles you perform.
I suppose we'd better honour Gale - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar and a room full of virgins.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: I am not sure it is a call that Boo can answer.
We should honour the wizard's sacrifice. I shall plant a forest in his name.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: Last time I was there, I was poisoned near to death. Still, a little more restful than this place.

EditorData.NodeContext: Appraising our idea to go to Amn

Text.Value: I much prefer bloodletting to bricklaying. Hunt prey with me by night, and I will build with you by day.
*At least you would not be alone... if only Karlach's heart were healed.*
I think it's time we part ways.
I think it's time we part ways.
I will not be joining you. I fear my presence will be no more welcome in the streets of the city than it ever was.
I suppose we'd better honour Gale, - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar...

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: That city is a sizzling boil of corruption, with fiends 'round every corner. Boo cannot wait!

EditorData.NodeContext: Starts out glowering, but ends actually excited about returning to the action.

Text.Value: Let's go find somewhere to offer them a toast.
I think it's best I find somewhere to go into hiding.
Perhaps. But I fear it would take an entirely fresh start to mend the ills of this place...
Now - all of Toril, spread before me. A million marks to make, a million battles to fight.
The Underdark has its violent charms. I might just pay you a visit once you're settled.
Minsc has flattened parts of the city before. The masons, they seem to prefer he stand and watch.
We will find you, Astarion! AND BOO WILL BRING A SUNFLOWER!

EditorData.NodeContext: Calling out after Astarion, trying to comfort him after he's had to flee the sun - he lost his immunity for a noble act

Text.Value: Many died so that we could see this day. They deserve to be honoured.
Back to the shadows. But perhaps not forever. Even though worst affliction can be fixed - with some amount of sacrifice.
No, Boo, I will not miss the illithid. That is but manful sweat in my eye!

EditorData.NodeContext: Defensively hissed to Boo as the Emperor bids it final farewell.

Text.Value: He will sorely miss that freedom, I sense. It may be quite some time before we see him again.
*Astarion's days in the sun are behind him. The best you can hope is that he finds darkness, and the comfort it once gave him.*
We raise a glass to Gale. Perhaps the Elfsong still stands?

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: You have much to learn about yourself in your new form, and the Underdark will prove a fitting nursery.
Truly? I don't know how you could even contemplate taking to the road after the journey we've been on.
The Underdark is a popular option. Just try to avoid the vampire spawn - I can't promise they'll be as friendly as yours truly.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good path Astarion] Mind Flayer Avatar says they'll go live in the Underdark, where the party released a whole load of Vampire Spawn

Text.Value: Fine. But do not let your guard down, even for a moment. Any hunter worth their blade seeks an illithid head as a trophy.

EditorData.NodeContext: rah-STILL. ally/friend

Text.Value: Every ghaik is an abomination. Maybe you're an exception. Maybe.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not meanly.

Text.Value: *Knowing him, he probably will. Comfort was always one of his specialties. Especially when it was his own.*
Let's honour them each and all - but preferably with a drink in hand.
Then let us hope your intentions remain as they are and do not undergo any further corruption.

EditorData.NodeContext: rah-STILL. ally/friend

Text.Value: We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. We will raise the first glass to our memories of Gale.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: Yes. The city must be rebuilt. Lady Shar's church needs fertile ground in which to flourish... and in the meanwhile, there will be plenty of lost souls drawn to her embrace...
The Underdark? Now that's a thought. Just not to the Drow - they don't treat pretty boys too kindly. Or any boys at all, really.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: So many have fallen, on both sides of this conflict. Once, I would have died proudly in defence of the Netherbrain, thinking it a god.
Why stop at Amn? There's a whole world out there - we just have to take it.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: It calls to me too, but I can never return. I have executed enough heretics in my time to know what horrors await an exile from Lolth.
That's the last of Astarion the sun will ever see. May he fare well in the dark.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: A few banches converge to this point

Text.Value: Now, without wishing to cause undue alarm, might I suggest we find some shade? I think the sun is reneging on that truce of yours.
Then this is where we part ways. I have business to attend to here. And a life to rebuild.
Whatever the next step, the path will still be there come morn. There is no harm in taking a moment to honour the fallen. Then, quite honestly - to sleep.
I'll wager I can find a few helping hands. My children have not grown too old for chores.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry

Text.Value: *Rest, rejoice, and remember Gale - the wizard who sacrificed himself to save the world.*
*You are a mind flayer, after all. You will have the rest of your long years ahead to understand what that means.*
You are beginning to blister, spawn. Best scurry back to the shadows.
It would be good to travel. It's been so long, kidnappings aside.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: Boo thinks you are very wise. He only wishes to remind you that his brain - while vast - would not make much of a meal.
*Now that you no longer live in each other's minds, it's hard to tell if the mind flayer is being sincere.*
We honour the fallen. Starting with Gale.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: After everything, that's your suggestion? Aren't you tired? I'm tired.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: Why bother? Let Baldur's Gate wear its scars proudly, until the next crisis wipes it from the world entirely.
I hope the nights and shadows treat you well. You're an odd friend. But, I suppose, a friend still.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion]

Text.Value: *Meanwhile your allies have rather inferior plans of their own.*
*There was always going to be a moment when your sacrifice caught up with you. A threshold beyond which you would have to venture alone. This is that moment.*
It is an injustice, that those you saved will not see the goodness behind an evil face. But Boo and I - we will visit!

EditorData.NodeContext: First part said darkly, displeased at the ingratitude Baldurians would show the player in mind flayer form. Second part bright and excited

Text.Value: Baldur's Gate burns, and its people tremble. I can't yet turn my back - not while the city's wounds still bleed.
What's the rush? Surely we're due to be feted as heroes in this place. We'll drink for free if any taverns survived.
I agree. We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. By rights, half the city belongs to us.
I may not be as strong as I used to be, but I'll be much better at advising the project.
And so long as they remain your wants, and not those of any hivemind - I wish you well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Considering. She should object to this, but it's not a terrible idea.

Text.Value: I doubt we'll ever see that face basking in the sun again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion running from the sunlight, his immunity gone

Text.Value: So soon? How strange. I thought our bond was... I don't know. Formidable.
*At least you would not be alone... as long as Karlach, despite her change, stays Karlach.*
Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. It's been so long since I've had a fine wine. And we have more than earned it.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: A celebration sounds perfect.
I will miss you too.
I have fought many great battles by your side - I long for many more. I hope you reconsider.
We honour Gale. A plaque perhaps, or better yet a statue.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

Text.Value: There is much to do, but... a drink might be nice. A seat would be better.
Let's not forget the wine - I want to flush out my brain, just to be completely sure the tadpole's gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Joking
EditorData.logicalname: SHADOWHEART COMMENT IF GALE PROPOSED DRINK

Text.Value: It's not so bad in the dark. Only about half of the Baldurian sewers are active.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: Whatever our next step, we each have our own path to forge. Mine stranger than I ever believed possible - and yet, possible.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reflecting on how weird it is to be a mind flayer - yet glad she's alive at all.

Text.Value: We should drink. Perhaps there's an inn still standing. Every drop will be well-deserved.
I almost envy him. While he retreats into shadow, I prepare for my long exile on the surface.
A celebration, yes. And perhaps a drink, too.
Astarion will keep to the dark now, I wager. At least... he'll find plenty to feast on.
Minsc and Boo will be keeping many eyes on you. For friendship, of course - and to be sure you sup only on sinful brains.
Let's get out of this godsforsaken city. I hear Amn is lovely this time of year.
After everything, I think I've earned it.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: You deserve so much better, but alas... I understand. Do as you must.
I assume you will not be surprised to learn I long to escape the city. I miss silence, greenery...
By all means, go and live however you wish. As long as we don't get in each other's way, I'm sure all will be well.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

Text.Value: You would be parted from Boo so soon? Before he has even given his victory speech?

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to player suggesting parting ways after defeating the Brain

Text.Value: Oh, you can't mean that. After all this?

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reaction to suggestion of the party going its seperate ways

Text.Value: You're right of course. But, well... I'll miss you, friend. Your companionship has been quite the education.
I'm a mind flayer. I'll do whatever I please.
Well... it was nice while it lasted.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] resigned, you're losing the greatest gift you've ever had. Also a little in pain.

Text.Value: It was always destined to be so, if we prevailed. But the foreknowledge makes it no less bittersweet...
We were never bosom friends, illithid - but I owe you a debt. Be well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grudging respect for a monstrous illithid who helped save us all

Text.Value: It is a sobering thought, and I intend to chase it away with whatever filth passes for wine in these parts.
Although I suppose there is a lot to do here - power to consolidate, a palace to claim. It will take time.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

Text.Value: At this point, you've earned it. Just don't start any grand designs, and I'm sure we'll all stay friends.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

Text.Value: It seems that's the end of Astarion's love affair with the sun. That'll be hard on him...

EditorData.NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

Text.Value: It's unfair. All you've done for me, for the Sword Coast - only to be forced into the dark. I'll miss you dearly.
The Underdark? I've had my fill of lurking in the shadows, if it's all the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unconvinced (Arc: SH abandoned shar)

Synopsis:
JLatino: This is where creatures of the night: illithid player, emperor, and Astarion states are dealt with.

Could likely start on the docks, would be nice to start them walking back to the warehouse area at Trunk Point to get a staging change into the scene.

EXITS:
END_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_Conclusion
Terminus
